main event: At 1050 EST on 19 August 1948, an unidentified flying object was reported visible from Godman Air Force Base, Kentucky, which was later identified as the planet Venus.
interesting points: The object was observed at an altitude of approximately 30,000 to 100,000 feet and appeared spherical with a bright silver color reflecting sunlight., The F-51 aircraft dispatched to observe the object could not locate it but it was visible from the ground., The sighting lasted for approximately 2 hours., Azimuth and elevation readings were taken every minute as the object's progress was charted., Various military personnel and an astronomer confirmed the identification of the object as Venus based on its location and visibility.
sighted object: unidentified flying object later identified as Venus
witness description: Lt. Colonel John Weurth, Executive Officer, Godman AFB
